snippet: With knee injuries for Baron Davis, Jeremy Lin and Iman Shumpert, it has been a playoff season of agony for the Knicks, and no one can speak to the repercussions better than Bernard King, now an analyst for the MSG Network.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column holds that with knee injuries for New York Knicks guards Baron Davis, Jeremy Lin and Iman Shumpert, it has been a playoff season of agony for the Knicks; notes that no one knows better than former Knicks forward Bernard King, now an MSG Network analyst; recalls that after sustaining major knee ligament damage in 1985, King took nearly two years of rehabilitation before returning to action.
lead_paragraph: With knee injuries for Baron Davis, Jeremy Lin and Iman Shumpert, it has been a playoff season of agony for the Knicks, and no one can speak to the repercussions better than Bernard King, now an analyst for the MSG Network.

headline.seo: For Bernard King, Scars From Knee Surgery Fade, but Pain Remains
headline.main: Scars From Knee Surgery Fade, but There’s Pain in Every Step
